Bash(gh pr create --base develop --title "Fix macOS binary signing and notarization in release workflow" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Summary

- Fix `if` condition checks for Apple signing secrets by moving secret-to-env mappings to job level
- The previous approach checked `env.APPLE_CERTIFICATE` before secrets were mapped to environment variables, causing signing/notarization steps to always be skipped
- Updates both `build-cli-macos` and `build-electron-macos` jobs

## Changes

- Added job-level `env` blocks that map secrets to environment variables
- Updated `if` conditions to use `${ env.X != '''' }` syntax (secrets cannot be reliably checked directly in `if` conditions)
- Removed redundant step-level env blocks
- Fixed notarization password env var reference (`APPLE_ID_PASSWORD` instead of `APPLE_APP_SPECIFIC_PASSWORD`)

## Test plan

- [ ] Verify secrets are configured in GitHub repository settings
- [ ] Create a test release tag to trigger the workflow
- [ ] Confirm signing and notarization steps run (not skipped)
- [ ] Download macOS binary and verify it opens without Gatekeeper warning
